title: Palindromic Substrings
description: Given a string s, return the number of palindromic substrings in it. A string is a palindrome when it reads the same backward as forward. A substring is a contiguous sequence of characters within the string.
constraints: s consists of lowercase English letters.

brute-force.name: Expand Around Center
brute-force.description: Count palindromes expanding from each center.

steps.instruction: Define the function count_substrings that takes s.

steps.hint: Initialize a counter for the number of palindromes found.
Iterate through each character in the string, treating it as the center of a potential palindrome.

steps.placeholderCode:
l, r = i, i
        while l >= 0 and r < len(s) and s[l] == s[r]:
            res += 1
            l -= 1
            r += 1
steps.hint:
Expand outwards from single character center (odd length). Increment count for each valid palindrome found.

Example:
S="aaa". i=1 ('a').
L=1, R=1. "a". Count++.
L=0, R=2. "aaa". Count++.
L=-1. Stop.
steps.solutionCode:
l, r = i, i
        while l >= 0 and r < len(s) and s[l] == s[r]:
            res += 1
            l -= 1
            r += 1

steps.placeholderCode:
l, r = i, i + 1
        while l >= 0 and r < len(s) and s[l] == s[r]:
            res += 1
            l -= 1
            r += 1
steps.hint: Expand outwards from between characters (even length). Increment count for each valid palindrome found.
steps.solutionCode:
l, r = i, i + 1
        while l >= 0 and r < len(s) and s[l] == s[r]:
            res += 1
            l -= 1
            r += 1

steps.hint: Return the total count of palindromic substrings.
